section.title: Research Publications
section.subtitle: Our Latest Publications
section.description: Explore our research contributions that are advancing the field of empathic computing and human-computer interaction.

publications.title: Empathic Computing: Bridging the Gap Between Human Emotions and AI
publications.authors: Prof. Mark Billinghurst, Dr. Sarah Chen
publications.abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive framework for developing empathic computing systems that can recognize, understand, and respond to human emotions in real-time.

publications.title: Real-time Emotion Recognition in Virtual Reality Environments
publications.authors: Dr. James Rodriguez, Dr. Emily Watson
publications.abstract: We explore novel methods for detecting emotional states in VR environments using multimodal sensor data and machine learning algorithms.

publications.title: Adaptive User Interfaces for Emotional Computing Systems
publications.authors: Dr. Lisa Thompson, Dr. Michael Kim
publications.venue: CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing
publications.abstract: This work investigates how user interfaces can dynamically adapt based on detected emotional states to improve user experience and engagement.

publications.title: Collaborative Empathic Systems: Design Principles and Applications
publications.authors: Dr. Alex Patel, Prof. Mark Billinghurst
publications.abstract: We present design principles for creating collaborative systems that facilitate empathic communication between remote users.

publications.title: Machine Learning Approaches for Emotion Recognition in Educational Settings
publications.authors: Dr. Rachel Green, Dr. Sarah Chen
publications.venue: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Education
publications.abstract: This study examines the application of empathic computing in educational environments to enhance student learning outcomes.

publications.title: Ethical Considerations in Empathic AI Systems
publications.authors: Dr. Emily Watson, Dr. Lisa Thompson
publications.abstract: We discuss the ethical implications of systems that can detect and respond to human emotions, including privacy and consent considerations.

publications.title: Cross-Cultural Emotion Recognition in Computing Systems
publications.authors: Dr. Michael Kim, Dr. Alex Patel
publications.abstract: This research explores how cultural differences affect emotion expression and recognition in computing systems.

publications.title: Physiological Signal Processing for Emotion Detection
publications.authors: Dr. James Rodriguez, Dr. Rachel Green
publications.abstract: We present advanced signal processing techniques for extracting emotional indicators from physiological sensors.

publications.title: Augmented Reality Interfaces for Empathic Communication
publications.authors: Prof. Mark Billinghurst, Dr. Lisa Thompson
publications.venue: ISMAR - International Symposium on Mixed and Augmented Reality
publications.abstract: This work explores how AR can be used to enhance empathic communication by visualizing emotional states and social cues.

publications.title: Longitudinal Study of Empathic Computing in Healthcare
publications.authors: Dr. Sarah Chen, Dr. Emily Watson
publications.abstract: A comprehensive study examining the long-term effects of empathic computing systems in healthcare settings.

publications.title: Natural Language Processing for Emotional Intelligence
publications.authors: Dr. Michael Kim, Dr. Rachel Green
publications.abstract: This paper presents novel NLP techniques for understanding emotional content in human communication.

publications.title: Designing Empathic Robots for Social Interaction
publications.authors: Dr. Alex Patel, Dr. James Rodriguez
publications.abstract: We explore the design principles for creating robots capable of empathic social interaction with humans.
